> decided to use the fail() method within the catch block, instead of
> re-throwing the exception.

Your test is considered as "failure" and not as "error" (in both cases 
you have a problem).  Otherwise it doesn't change anything.

The fail(Throwable) throws a subclass of AssertionFailedError that 
supports chained exceptions: so that you won't loose one bit of the 
stacktrace.  So please, please no more "fail(e.getMessage())"!

-Vladimir
